Reviews.Title: No good. Don't trust it.
Reviews.Author: Catman
Reviews.Content: Our local news station along with the fire department tested this bag. They tested multiple bags with fire temperature less than 800 deg F and all documents enclosed were turned to ashes. Also a seam on one of the test bags came apart in the fire exposing the contents to direct fire.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF FIBERGLASS!
Reviews.Author: adams "biker"
Reviews.Content: I admit, I should have read all the negative reviews before buying this product.When mine arrived I just took it out of the packaging. I did not notice all those small needles until about an hour later when I noticed itching on my hands. But before that I touched my face. Many times. And my pants were covered with a lot of this stuff. Imagine that.Oh, there was a warning about fiberglass. True. On the back of the packages in small print! But nothing on Amazon.After inspecting the product I noticed many very thin needles on the bag. Some 5 inches in length, but most under a quarter of an inch. The bag was really covered with this stuff. An edge was ripped off a bit producing even more needles.This product is not worth buying at any price. I can't imagine having to use gloves each time to touch my documents. I do not want to be arrested at the airport because someone touching my passport got some strange itching.When I was buying this I thought this is a thick bag made of several layers of different fabrics. One layer for thermal insulation, and at least one for making this bag airtight under high temperature - like melting but burn proof plastic. This bag doesn't have anything like that. The air can flow in and out of this bag. Because of oxygen in high temperature the documents will get charred even before the fire touches the bag.Bad design, bad craftsmanship and bad packaging.

Reviews.Title: Fiberglass Fiber Warning
Reviews.Author: B. Lunsford
Reviews.Content: It took days for the fiberglass fibers to get off of me.  I never touched it again, with bare hands.  Was going to donate it to local flea market, but decided not to inflict anyone else with it.  Even when I tossed it into the trash, I taped a note to the outside of the package, warning of the loose fibers.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: desertchica
Reviews.Content: This isn't a bag. It is a cloth foldover thing - that kind of looks like a small pillow case - made of fiberglass. Fiberglass has shards. It makes you itchy. And there is a warning on the "bag" that this 'sheds'. This is going back. The description is very misleading. Do not buy this.

Reviews.Title: Fiberglass splinters from touching bag
Reviews.Author: William J. Watson "Astron"
Reviews.Content: Like some other reviewers, I got fiberglass splinters as soon as I touched the bag the first time. Awful product I'll be throwing in the trash.

Reviews.Title: Fiberglass warning
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before purchasing, and figured the postings about fiberglass were overdone. No they aren't. I just got done using packing tape on my fingers to remove the fibers. Do not purchase this product. Fiberglass fibers are tiny and you will have a hard time seeing them, but you can sure feel them in your fingers. I am returning the item to Amazon as a defective product.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY, YOU WILL ITCH ALL NIGHT!
Reviews.Author: SWEN-TECH
Reviews.Content: IT'S LIKE ASBESTOS!I along with the tons of people on here, didn't read the reviews.. and didn't pay attention till, the other night, I was putting document in the sleeve, then I noticed how itchy my hands got... then I noticed it was Fiberglass (!GLASS PARTICLES).. and my legs and hands had tiny glass particles on them.  Spent 4 hours all night, taking cold shower after cold shower, trying to get rid of the glass.  Had to wash my clothes seperatley and vaacume the closet, carefully, to get up any remaining particles.I'm not kidding, NOT WORTH IT!ProsLooks NeatConsExpensiveWill get into your skinLike AsbestosHealth HazardNot worth it!Swen(Charlotte, NC)

Reviews.Title: Seems okay to me and price was right
Reviews.Author: EastOfTheRockies
Reviews.Content: Reading the negative reviews made me hesitent on buying this product.  Taking a chance for under $10.00 (another site wanted $24.00) I bought it and have to give a thumbs up.  I use this product as additional protection for documents stored in a fire resistent safe.  I had no problems with fiberglass shedding at all.  The bag is large enough to put several documents inside, is flexible and sturdy.  Will buy another one.  Hope this review helps you decide.  ThanksUPDATE:  I bought two more bags.  One of the bags shed some fibers onto my shirt.  My shirt was dark blue so I could see the fibers.  I still consider the bags useful, affordable and suitable for their intended purpose.

Reviews.Title: Fire-proof vs. fire-resistant
Reviews.Author: J Z
Reviews.Content: I found this on a website and thought I'd share.  Be informed before you buy!Due to limitations of today's materials, all safe products are susceptible to heat and fire damage when exposed to high temperatures for extended periods of time. Thus, no safe product manufactured today is considered "fire proof". Certain materials can provide resistance to high temperatures for limited periods of time. Safes properly constructed with these materials can be classified as "fire resistant". Depending upon the materials used and the methods of construction, safes can provide varying degrees of fire resistance.What level of fire resistance do I need?In a home fire, the peak temperature and duration of the fire can vary depending upon the size of the home, the materials used to construct the home, the response time of firefighters, etc. It is estimated that the typical peak temperature in a home fire ranges from 800 to 1200 degrees Fahrenheit. The typical time for firefighting authorities to bring a home fire into containment is estimated at 15 to 30 minutes. Paper chars at approximately 402°F. To protect paper documents, the internal temperature of a safe must remain below 350°F while exposed to the conditions of the typical home fire. Thus at a minimum, a safe should provide enough fire resistance to keep the maximum internal temperature of the safe below 350°F, when exposed to external temperatures of 1200 degrees for 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: I hope it works when needed
Reviews.Author: Guitartec "DBF"
Reviews.Content: I just bought this bag to keep the paper valuables in my safe, that much safer. The ad says this 100% fiberglass bag will withstand temperatures up to 1000 degrees- seems this nice, round number is probably more for advertising purposes than it is factual. I would bet a major house fire that destroys an entire home would truly see hotter temperatures than that. The actual packaging says nothing at all about temperature or the amount of protection you can expect. Even so, for 10 bucks I like the added security. Most house fires don't end up in total destruction, so if this bag can add some time for fire fighters to put out the blaze, I'm in!

Reviews.Title: Plastics and 350F safes
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Here is why an item like this is so valuable:The vast majority of fire-retarding safes are rated to keep their interiors no hotter than 350F for 1-2 hours in a fire, depending on the model. This is fine for documents, metals, and other durable goods, but many common plastics melt at much lower temperatures:PETE: 230F (plastic bags)LDPE: 248F (food storage containers, optical media)HDPE: 266F (bottles, bottle caps)PVC:  360F (credit cards)PVC beats the mark for its melting point, but bear in mind that all plastics soften and warp at much lower temperatures than they melt. Anyone that's put a food storage container or plastic utensil too near a dishwasher's heating element, or left optical media on their car's dashboard on a sunny day, knows this well.Fiberglass is not flameproof, but it can persistently resist up to 1,200F. The loose weave of this particular product is rated for 1,000F. This makes it feasible to keep valuable plastics in your 350F fire safe (think backup media, mothballed credit cards, spare keys with plastic-covered handles, etc.).I have only one of these bags, and did not see any loose fibers when it came out of the box. Due to the many negative reviews I have treated it carefully. I put my items in the bag without stretching it, and gently folded it over. I do not plan to go into the bag more than once every few years, so wear and tear is not a concern for me.

Reviews.Title: Quality is Ok.
Reviews.Author: Boogie_18
Reviews.Content: I like this product, but it is already ripping. I have a bunch of documents in it, but I was surprised the sides were ripping when I barely even handle it.

Reviews.Title: It is fire resistant
Reviews.Author: Patricia Rivas "Patty"
Reviews.Content: I was worried to purchase this after reading the reviews but decided what the hell it's less than $10 so I bought it. I received it the next day with amazons free 2 day shipping. Very surprise how fast the shipping was. After receiving it I put a magazine inside the bag and held it over an open fire, it did not burn or go up in flames. The corner did turn brown after a while. When I took out the magazine it was fine, a bit warm but the bag on the other hand cooled down faster then the magazine. You could fit a magazine with plenty of room. So you could easily put forms of identification or any other important documents, money, pictures and I thing you could fit a album if it's not too thick. It's just what I needed so I'm pretty happy, hoping I never have to use it for an emergency, but then again you never know so better safe than sorry.

Reviews.Title: NOT FOR CONTINUAL USE!!!!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Maki "American"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our office to put invoices and checks in the safe each night. The first one fell apart in 4 months. We bought another thinking the first one was defective, it fell apart in 2 months!!! I have one at home in the safe that I don't touch and it is ok, but I would not buy another one for sure:(

Reviews.Title: Do not buy. Ineffective, shoddy, unsafe.
Reviews.Author: L. B. Glass
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this product. Merely handling it will stick your fingers with tiny glass needles (breathing them would be quite dangerous), and it's too thin to provide any protection at all against fire. A shoddy, dangerous, ineffective product, and one of the few items I have ever returned to Amazon the day I received it.

Reviews.Title: Warning - do not open this in your home.
Reviews.Author: Allergy Sufferer
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but I have to warn people against this. It is a nightmare. I don't know how I will get rid of all the shardsfrom this. I am shutting down my computers now to vacuum as I opened it in 1 room and brought it into another.

Reviews.Title: Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Daly
Reviews.Content: I will use this inside a fire proof safe for added protection. A small price for a little peace of mind. I did read the reviews warning of fiberglass so I will handle with care.

Reviews.Title: not really worth it
Reviews.Author: Ivan J.
Reviews.Content: Under direct flame, it burns (tested it myself).  I guess it's better than nothing and works better in conjunction with other methods, like a firebox or safe.

Reviews.Title: What's up with everyone!
Reviews.Author: Jolly Holly Jo
Reviews.Content: I don't know what people expect for 10 bucks.  This bag is perfectly fine.  it is well made and  a large size.  I will use mine as an added protection for cash inside my 2 hour safe.  Fast Service as always from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: just what I needed
Reviews.Author: laura
Reviews.Content: fits papers perfect. I bought a safe but it wasn't fire proof and I was worried about our birth certificates and books that my deceased mom wrote in for me. I put my items in a large zip lock bag first so they wouldn't get fiberglass on them.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Product
Reviews.Author: indysafe317
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these and within a month the seams came apart.  Read all the reviews and you will find this is a common problem.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY on this, it doesn't stand up outside of a fire so why risk it in a fire.

Reviews.Title: fiberglass threads slice your hand // lungs?
Reviews.Author: D. Holmer "good reading"
Reviews.Content: No idea if this bag works for fire protection or not, but you don't want to stick your hand inside it... your hand will sting for days from the fiberglass threads taking microslices out of it.  And for goodness sake wear a facemask around it.. you don't want to breathe any of that junk that may float up from the bag.

Reviews.Title: This is terrible.
Reviews.Author: dbrrr0
Reviews.Content: It sheds and causes itching.  If you buy this product open it outside and leave it there or give it to someone you hate.

Reviews.Title: wow really well made
Reviews.Author: Ronald Dailey
Reviews.Content: This fire resistant bag, for the money, is very roomy for one. A lot more capacity than I thought it would have. Also is very well made. Thank's for a great product!

Reviews.Title: Fire resistant bag
Reviews.Author: Peter A. Foronda
Reviews.Content: Price seems OK. bag is fairly heavy weight and flexible enough to conform to unusual shapes.  Has a folded hem sewn into it to help protect document.

Reviews.Title: Fiberglass itching hell
Reviews.Author: J. D. Jonsson "Famous Mortimer"
Reviews.Content: I put my documents in this bag and put it inside my fireproof safe. About 15 minutes later, I noticed fiberglass shards in my hands, and all over my clothes. I had to launder my clothes and shower to get the crap off. Now I want to get rid of the bag, but I dont want to touch my documents. I'm going to have to put on protective clothing and gloves, retrieve my documents, dispose of this thing, and vacuum out my firesafe, and my documents, and probably launder all my clothes and shower again.This is a crappy crappy product.

Reviews.Title: fire resistant document bag
Reviews.Author: piggie1
Reviews.Content: I did not expect the bag to contain fiber glass. i either missed it when I was looking at the infor on it or didn't realize it was there. When I took it out of the envelope it came in I was instantly pricked by glass shards. and there were lots of loose ones that got into my clothes. I had to change to get rid of them. I would not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Product description clearly warns people to wash hands after touching it or wear gloves!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Joyce Schneider "RKO341"
Reviews.Content: It's called COMMON SENSE.. and apparently not many people posses it, because what the hell else do you think would be used to make something that is FLAME RESISTANT??? Something frigging impenetrable and possibly harmful. Fiberglass is no joke and the product description clearly states that you need to WASH YOUR HANDS AFTER EACH TIME YOU TOUCH THE BAG OR YOU NEED TO WEAR GLOVES. I'm sure that they literally mean that, too. It's not a suggestion, it's the damn directions. Not hard to comprehend, yet I keep reading reviews where people are totally surprised and gave it less stars because of their own total lack of comprehension or failure to read the entire description. Others gave it less stars because the material shed and made them itchy, but they warned you to wash up or wear gloves because that's just what this product does. So it doesn't deserve less just because people didn't follow directions.One reviewer actually said she/he threw it in the washing machine!!! Why the hell would you do that!!? This isn't a pair of jeans that others tried on and you want them clean. Even if I saw little specs of something and didn't know it to be fiberglass, I'd figure it had to do with being fire resistant and leave it alone.From Amazon under "Product Description" ----"Store your fire bag flat in a safe spot that will not be subject to water should a fire occur. Made of woven fire resistant fiberglass (wash your hands each time after handling or wear gloves) 10"W x 15"H".Too long;didn't read version:DON'T PLAY WITH IT, SHOW PEOPLE, TOUCH IT A HUNDRED TIMES TRY TO CLEAN IT ETC.. BECAUSE THE S*** IS MADE OUT OF FIRE RESISTANT FIBERGLASS. WEAR GLOVES EACH TIME YOU TOUCH IT (WHICH SHOULD ONLY BE WHEN DOCUMENTS ARE NEEDED), BE CAREFUL WITH WHERE YOU HANDLE IT, THROW YOUR DOCUMENTS IN & SEAL IT, PUT THE WHOLE THING IN A ZIPLOCK BAG TO PREVENT SHEDDING, AND PUT IT AWAY. CASE CLOSED.

Reviews.Title: Wate of money
Reviews.Author: Christine Alexis Gay
Reviews.Content: Caused serious itching. Threw it away before even trying to use it. Do not waste your money on this item.

Reviews.Title: U.S. Patrol JB5076 Fire Resistant Document Bag
Reviews.Author: Mangnus
Reviews.Content: Not so impressive.Its itching while handling.People who are allergic need to be careful.Washing of hands required after every use.

Reviews.Title: Rating Is Not Real and Not Tested
Reviews.Author: R. Ramos
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the misfortune of testing these bags; but for the price they are a good alternative to the heavy expensive fire proof safes.  I guess 1 of them could be put on a BBQ pit to test fire resistance.  I'll try that and let you all if it burns the papers inside.  Do be gentle handling the bags as they have a fiber material that can pierce the skin.  Not bad but can be painful if kids handle them.

Reviews.Title: be careful with
Reviews.Author: B. Schendel
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend perhaps covering the bag inside and out with duct tape or something. Or maybe get a different bag. I've had trouble breathing over the last day, I think from unseen pieces of fiberglass, probably from either handling the bag or some items that were in the bag.

Reviews.Title: marginal protection very little
Reviews.Author: James Kahan
Reviews.Content: I got this with a water-resistant, fire-resistant safe because most people buying the safe also purchased the bag.  While it is not entirely useless, it adds little marginal value to the safe itself.  Probably not good value for money, but the money is not great.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product
Reviews.Author: Austin 34
Reviews.Content: I just got the product and when I pulled it out of the box i was amazed what it looked like it was a lot nice up close and it had a logo on it. I actualy bought four of these bags and put it in each one so they would keep out of harms way.  The delievery came on time the package was very secure

Reviews.Title: Great idea
Reviews.Author: BozSC
Reviews.Content: Not tested and hopefully won't have to. Great piece of mind for a small price. This is a good backup for fire safes.

Reviews.Title: A Place for Passport - Small Documents
Reviews.Author: Jason Rowe
Reviews.Content: It's ok. I bought it for added protection for a few small items I put into the safe.  It is a tight fit,  would not recommend for more that one small item.

Reviews.Title: So glad I bought it
Reviews.Author: J.W.
Reviews.Content: This is great for putting in your documents (birth certificates, important receipts, etc.) you'd like to store at home with the security they're safe from fire.  Very glad I bought it.  Great gift idea to give to family and friends who have documents they'd like protected.

Reviews.Title: Smart Purchase
Reviews.Author: Lavon Przybylski
Reviews.Content: Order came quickly and I was pleasantly surprised at the generous size of the bags. I had bought one before from another place and it cost more and was half the size of these. I am well pleased.

Reviews.Title: Fire Resistant Document Bag
Reviews.Author: CDR
Reviews.Content: Even though I read all the reviews I thought people were being overly dramatic about the itching and stinging this material causes but they were correct about that.  The Pros are:  It is a nice large bag and very innocent looking fabric and nicely made  but beware....I wore heavy duty rubber gloves but somewhere along the line my clothes picked up the fiberglass particles (I could not see them) and I ended up with stinging and itching skin.  The worst was my eyes and I did not rub them either.  I will wear goggles if I need to get anything out of the bag.  My eyes stung and were watering for days after handling the bag.I ordered two.  I kept one and threw the other one out.  I put my documents first in a paper envelope then into the fiberglass bag.  Next I think i will wrap the Fire resistant bag in heavy duty foil so I won't have to touch it at all.  It will be a process to get anything out but there isn't much on the market that will (hopefully) save important documents from fire. Obviously I am very allergic to this material. My husband will be the one to take the documents out next time.I was glad I read the reviews before opening the package from the PO or I think I would've been in worse shape.  I think it should be noted in HEAVY PRINT AND CAPITAL LETTERS TO BE CAREFUL WHEN TOUCHING THIS MATERIAL up the top of the page near the picture not WAY down on the page...I don't buy much on line and didn't go that far down but I did read the reviews so I knew all about it.  !!!! I was going to use the second one for my jewelry but obviously that won't work.I would have asked for a refund but I didn't want to touch the bag to send it back. So I am out $7.00

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: Margaret Fryer
Reviews.Content: I bought this item as a back up to my fire safe and I am pleased with how they work.I also gave one to my friend and he also was pleased with the amount of product it holds,

Reviews.Title: Good Stuff
Reviews.Author: vangie
Reviews.Content: This is good,looks like it will work the job...I will use it to protect my important documents.I will buy more.

Reviews.Title: It is a good one
Reviews.Author: Lee Hong
Reviews.Content: it is easy to use and clean. and easy to hide. i bought a lot and share with my coworkers

Reviews.Title: Fire Resistant Bag
Reviews.Author: Cedric Bonner
Reviews.Content: If you want to potect you things, this is the bag for you. It is good  if you have a fire. Buy it.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Itchy after Handling
Reviews.Author: Bryan Saunders
Reviews.Content: The product works as advertised. I set one on fire with papers inside and the papers were fine. The package states to wear gloves when handling the bag, and I strongly recommend it. It is made of Fiberglass and you will be really itchy afterwards if you do not wear gloves.

Reviews.Title: Fire Bag
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: Great size for letters hope it works, it looks well sewn the materials used to make it,I can not use anything for a comparison. Received fast shipping.

Reviews.Title: I have not fire tested one of these
Reviews.Author: The Papist
Reviews.Content: I like it for the idea of it, but without actually putting a flame to one I can't give it 5 stars

Reviews.Title: I hope I never find out if it really works.
Reviews.Author: Joshua Whitley
Reviews.Content: I bought this to put my most important documents in INSIDE of a fire safe. I'm a fan of redundancy. The quality seems good. It was big enough to put my birth certificate, diploma and many other documents in. The best part about this pouch is actually the piece of mind it brings. I've had to replace all of the things in this bag before due to a tornado and it was quite a hassle. Now I have this in a bright pink fire safe so hopefully it'll be easy enough to find should my previous situation arise again. Fire proof and highly visible...should have my bases covered.

Reviews.Title: Looks Legit
Reviews.Author: Jagpreet S. Bajaj "Jack Singh"
Reviews.Content: Dont have the heart to put it to test but it holds my documents safely in my fireproof safe. It is big enough to hold few 8-11 sheets with other documents. I would recommend to invest in one to safeguard your important documents from fire.

Reviews.Title: Document Bag
Reviews.Author: C. PATTERSON
Reviews.Content: These bags are pretty good bags. However, they are made of fiberglass and don't hold up well to repeated use. I use them as document storage so, I probably go into them 3 or 4 times a year. I have several that are just coming apart at the seams and some just unraveling. Of course I can't say it isn't from over stuffing the bags. I have done this on occasion and thus can't say the bags aren't performing as designed. Because these are made of fiberglass or something like that they will cause you discomfort when you handle them. My solution is to use rubber exam gloves when I need something out of one of the bags. This is my standard handling procedure to "stop the itch" so to speak. So far, this has worked pretty well.

Reviews.Title: Won't know if it works until its too late
Reviews.Author: silverd2
Reviews.Content: This is an item that you hope you never find out if it actually works. I store passports and important papers in the motor home while I travel. It is well made and appears to do the job it was intended to do.

Reviews.Title: Hope they work..... Don't want to star on fire....
Reviews.Author: retired reader
Reviews.Content: Really haven't tried to see if they are fire proof.  Hope I don't ever find out.  But these allowed us to bolt a very strong non fireproof safe onto a cement wall ... Place document in sacks and feel very secure that we have done our best to protect all those important papers which usually go into a safety deposit box.  Kinda like not making that trip to the bank.

Reviews.Title: looks like  a good product
Reviews.Author: Veronica Jean Anderson
Reviews.Content: I like the product but I am unable to describe in a lengthy note as to how it is - is a safe - did it fit in the wall - yes

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: PWS Mk1 Mod1
Reviews.Content: Hope I don't have a fire.  But, I'm happy to know my documents will be protected. Enough said.  Buy for protection.

Reviews.Title: Questionnable
Reviews.Author: John in Alex "John"
Reviews.Content: Not sure if this bag is needed.  Right now it is sitting on top of the safe.  Will probably put some important papers in it to be sure there is no water damage.  However, I feel the water prood safe is more important.

Reviews.Title: Nice additional protection
Reviews.Author: SharLe
Reviews.Content: This bag will be great protection for our important papers in the event of a fire.They can hold several items and I do plan to order more.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Hdz
Reviews.Content: Good product for the price. I was hoping a slimmer bag to easily store documents. I would recommend to all for safe keeping of documents,

Reviews.Title: Great idea
Reviews.Author: stangal
Reviews.Content: Love the size of the bag and everything that you can store in it for save keeping. Very flexible material so you can use it for anything. I plan to purchase more.

Reviews.Title: I don't get these reviews
Reviews.Author: Michael "Mike"
Reviews.Content: It matches the description. But I cannot say if it works.  I probably wont take the time to write one if this ever is actually tested out.  I just hope that I didn't waste my money on a bag.

Reviews.Title: Good bag ..watch for splinters
Reviews.Author: Pfunk
Reviews.Content: The bag is beefy, and well made, but one doesn't really know how fireproof it is until it's put it to the test (hopefully, that never happens!) One thing that's annoying, is sometime when you handle the bag you can get little fiberglass splinters.The bag instructions do warn you of this possibility.I use it as a stash bag for large bills that I keep in my safe. I've started to where latex gloves when I have to handle the bag, in order to prevent this from happening.

Reviews.Title: Bag is tight
Reviews.Author: Kathleen E Silverman
Reviews.Content: it is designed to protect your documents as another layer in the safe however it is pretty tight to get items in the pouch.

Reviews.Title: Seams split!
Reviews.Author: SSB
Reviews.Content: I purchased this from another source since it appeared to be a great idea.  In addition to the stickiness, the seams split rapidly, rendering it no better than nothing for fire protection.  Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great idead
Reviews.Author: Debra Vinson
Reviews.Content: This was a great suggestion to sell with the wall safe.  I would not have thought of it.  Thanks so much

Reviews.Title: Not worth the price
Reviews.Author: Fifthmarch "Betty"
Reviews.Content: Disappointing.  It was a fire proof bag.  For the cost I thought I would have more than just a fire resistantBag but that is what I ordered and that is what I got.  It was just expensive

Reviews.Title: Great Bargain and Useful but...
Reviews.Author: Rose McCune
Reviews.Content: I am allergic to fiberglass, which is the fireproof material in this bag, and every time I use it I itch terribly!  I have decided to wear gloves when I open the bag the next time and be careful not to rub against it as it even adheres to my clothes!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: L. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I didn't even know this existed until I found it on Amazon. It's big and thick and fits in my little fireproof safe. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: Durable!
Reviews.Author: Mariel
Reviews.Content: Very tough and durable.  It is a nice bag to keep important documents in and not have to worry about damage.  It is also nice we can keep our documents in our own safe verses a bank safe.

Reviews.Title: Safe and Secure
Reviews.Author: TopJwa
Reviews.Content: This is a safe and secure storage solution for your important documents. The bag is big and holds an impressive amount of paper.

Reviews.Title: Bag
Reviews.Author: Donald Streeter
Reviews.Content: My husband but our documents in this bag and placed them in our new fire safe we don't plan on taking the documents out any time soon so I can not rate that experience with this bag.

Reviews.Title: Fire Resistant Doc Bag
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great product to give that extra protection for critical personal information.  I put the documents in the bag and then in my fireproof safe for ultimate peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: document bag
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: some fibers come off when I touch the bag and it causes itching so I try to handle it as little as possible

Reviews.Title: Hope it works
Reviews.Author: Chrisp344
Reviews.Content: Ive got my documents into in. But not fires have ravaged my home yet, so idk if it works yet.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as described
Reviews.Author: Wldtat
Reviews.Content: Only one way to find out if it really works, and I'm not in any hurry to find out :)

Reviews.Title: Sturdy and solid!
Reviews.Author: Caleb Rule
Reviews.Content: Seems fairly sturdy, and I've easily placed many of my important documents (insurance, etc) in it.Very easy to store away, too! And for the price, I was very happy to snag one of these compared to $100+ for a safe. Only thing is, be careful to put it in a high place where flooding won't reach it, since it's fire but NOT water resistant.

Reviews.Title: good size
Reviews.Author: Miki Thomas
Reviews.Content: I like the size of this bag.  It holds a lot of documents.  I put it inside of the safe I bought, so it should keep things safe.  I hope I never have to find out.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Ehrich
Reviews.Content: Works just fine, I like it.  I like the peppermint gels, too.  It's all good.I don't like reviews on products, though.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: EDWARD JORDAN
Reviews.Content: luckly have not tried it out but it seems exactly as described very happy with purchasemay need a second one

Reviews.Title: In case of fire
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I guess we won't know how good this is unless there is a fire.  Hopefully between the safe and this bag my important documents will be good.  I hope to never find out!!

Reviews.Title: Fire Resistant Document Bag
Reviews.Author: Tina M Beltramo
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful invention! I just love this and I put it in my safe for safekeeping.  Great idea!!tmbeltramo Roselle, IL

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: This is a good addition for holding papers.  Fortunately, haven't had to test it out.  I suggest placing the contents of whatever you will be placing in this bag within foil and then placing in this bag.

Reviews.Title: Seems to work OK.
Reviews.Author: Stuart R. Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this for documents kept in a safe that is supposed to have moisture issues. So far, so good. Since I haven't had a fire...

Reviews.Title: Oustanding product
Reviews.Author: George Davis
Reviews.Content: If you need to protect your important documents from fire this is the way to do it. This is a great product a must have.

Reviews.Title: Good Protection for Important Documents
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Gettig
Reviews.Content: Hopefully have safeguarded birth certificates, marriage license, and other items, feel better in case of unplanned accidents that do happen to everyone, never hurts to be careful

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: J. Hollenbeck
Reviews.Content: Was shipped quickly and and no problems encountered.I was applied to what I wanted it for and works as needed.

Reviews.Title: Very heavy bag
Reviews.Author: Jeannie
Reviews.Content: This seems like a great bag. The only bad thing is you need to put on rubber gloves to reach in the bag if you have a sensitive reaction to what I believe is asbestos fibers. It itches. but if you put in ziplock first it would be better. I really feel it will do what it is intended to do. I put my papers in it in the safe.

Reviews.Title: Fire Resistant Document Bags
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Spring
Reviews.Content: fire resistant document bag: I gave this rating because i was allergic to them and for me it was not a good product.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: These are easy to use.  After reading some of the reviews about the fiberglass issue I decided to always use gloves when handling them and have not had any issue with the fiberglass.  Cannot say if they really are fire resistant and hope I never have to find out.

Reviews.Title: Enough space to hold legal size documents
Reviews.Author: brightsun
Reviews.Content: The inside of the bag is made of glass fibers. Cannot be handled with bare hands. Need to use gloves while handling the bag.

Reviews.Title: Sheds fiber glass splinters
Reviews.Author: J. Roberts
Reviews.Content: The splinters make it difficult to fill and handle the bag. I hope it works as advertised in a fire.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!!
Reviews.Author: RAC
Reviews.Content: The fiberglass shavings from these bags are a nightmare!  They cause extreme skin irritation and are hard to get rid of once they are on your skin or clothing.

Reviews.Title: Good price!
Reviews.Author: BBCaprice
Reviews.Content: Amazon suggested this item with the purchase of my safe. Extra big and plenty of room. Good idea to keep all of my important papers in one bag. Have not tried out to see if it is fire proof?

Reviews.Title: Great Bag
Reviews.Author: VeronCoffin
Reviews.Content: Good size and great price. I will deffinitly order more when needed. I hope I never have to test these out. But i'm glad I have them.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: this is a must for protecting documents, cash ect from fire damage.  I use these in my safe for added protection. They are well made. Do thye work? Fortunately haven't found that out yet.

Reviews.Title: gift
Reviews.Author: keen reader "bookclubber"
Reviews.Content: necessary part of security gift.  If you've survived a fire or flood, you'll understand . A must for for apartment living.

Reviews.Title: Worth piece of mind.
Reviews.Author: Misty
Reviews.Content: Seems pricey, but after having friends have fires and lose so much,  this was a no brainer.  One friend actually had this and her papers came thru the fire...

Reviews.Title: Bags for Documents
Reviews.Author: C. L. Strickler
Reviews.Content: These are perfect for that extra protection....very good value too. Goes great with the safe and will be valuable. thanks

Reviews.Title: Decent, Can only hope i never find out if it works
Reviews.Author: Carim Mohamed
Reviews.Content: Decent, Can only hope i never find out if it worksDecent, Can only hope i never find out if it works

Reviews.Title: Fire Resistant Document Bag
Reviews.Author: Pamela Elkas
Reviews.Content: The Bag was thin enough to place in different areas of the home, yet large enough to place important papers. I liked the size. As for the "Fire Resistant". I cannot answer that as I have not been in a fire, which I hope never happens. IF there was a fire, hopefully, this bag will keep all safe from fire.

Reviews.Title: Ok product
Reviews.Author: Kaleb
Reviews.Content: I am not sure if this bag would protect things in a fire, or not. I really do not want to find out. It seems like for some things it would work it has space for plenty of paper, but not much else. It is fiberglass and something else but it leaves fiberglass fuzz all over you and kind of irritates the skin. I would suggest buying some kind of fireproof box or safe. It would definitely be better than the bag but overall it might be a cheap alternative.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Woggie
Reviews.Content: This product works well in keeping important documents safe and yet easily available.  I will probably order a second one in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Important decision
Reviews.Author: Beto Rivera "Polyphazetik"
Reviews.Content: Very nice product.  Every important document you'd imagine can fit very nicely and can be safely stored. Passports, residence papers, life insurance and w/e else you might think of importance are all MUST store safely, this is the product for just that.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Patricia L. McFaul
Reviews.Content: I ordered these bags once before for myself. I was so pleased with them that I ordered more to give as gifts to family members. They are well worth the price!

Reviews.Title: WARNING: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Inga Burinskaya
Reviews.Content: WARNING: Don't buy-- if you touch this bad, it will put millions of tiny fiberglass needles in your hands. The pain is excruciating! I threw mine in the trash the day it arrived.

Reviews.Title: falls apart for no apparent reason, kind of useless
Reviews.Author: Norman Cutter "alyosha10"
Reviews.Content: I stored stuff in the bag for about a year,..when I went to open it, the side had split from top to bottom. Great,..if there'd been a fire, all my stuff would have burned up.I got another one,..it is now ripped open after a few months, by itself, for no reason other than the passage of time. Yes, for 10 bucks, what you get is a false sense of protection, and a nasty rash on your arms which lasts for 48 hours. How awesome is that. I am not giving it 1 star for the sole reason that it is pretty inexpensive. I hope Amazon finds another "fireproof bag" to sell with at least a modicum of quality.

Reviews.Title: works nice fits papers, passports and documents, etc. made of fiberglass
Reviews.Author: S. Deo "Sagar"
Reviews.Content: ok so it's different than the picture. in the picture it looks like a sort of regular paper envelope sleeve. but of course it can't be because it protects from fire and water. so it what actually looks like is this fabricky type of back that's made of fiberglass. so when you put the documents in the bag it appears at first that the document won't fit flat but once you put them all the way you realize there's plenty of room and there's a flap that comes over. i bought this store my documents, passports, etc. in and then in turn put it into a sentry safe that i also bought on amazon. so one thing i must stress. this bag is made of fiberglass and fiberglass materials shed onto your hands and the carpet. SO IF YOU HAVE AN INFANT WHO CRAWLS ON THE CARPET in that area, make sure to thoroughly vaccum the carpet afterwards. now i'm not trying to freak anyone out. adults work with fiberglass for brief amounts of time and are fine, but i'm just assuming that an infant doesn't have as strong as a sytem so if they grab one of the fibers off the ground (and infants grab every little of piece of anything they see on the carpet) and put into their mouth it might be decently harmful to them. my suggestion is to first grab all documents you plan to put in the bag first, then remove it from it's packaging on a table, then add contents to the bag and then store in your safe or wherever. wow i made it sound like a nuclear material or something. it's not just adding a note for any parents with infants out there. good value, good product.

Reviews.Title: Compared to my Nike shoebox, it's great!
Reviews.Author: Luba Roboto
Reviews.Content: I can't speak to the conflicting reviews that describe the direct testing of these bags. I can say that the use of fiberglass in fire resistant products is widespread, including some firefighters' jackets. For these applications, there are certifications involved. There is no such certification on the packaging of these bags, made in China. Nor is there any rating, as there would be for a fire safe. However, should this bag truly be 100% fiberglass mesh, it should do an adequate job of fire protection.I replaced my old Nike shoebox with a SentrySafe HD4100. There are other smaller, cheaper fire safes that also carry a specific fire protection rating, such as the SentrySafe 1100 or some of the First Alert models. I bought this bag as an extra level of protection inside the fire safe, and for that, it should be fine.This U.S. Patrol bag has a substantial feel to it, and a flap that closes over the contents, holding them inside. On the downside, there was some discoloration on the bag in a few spots, I believe from the cardboard packaging, but not enough to warrant a return. There is definitely shedding of fiberglass fibers. There were only a few when I first added my documents, but I suspect there will be many more as documents are repeatedly removed and returned to the bag.For $10, I bought a little extra price of mind for my document storage, and am content with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: ...a good investment to secure papers/cash/etc.
Reviews.Author: S. Silvers
Reviews.Content: ...this should provide some piece of mind against possible fire damage to important documents.  you can use this inside of a non fire-proof safe.

Reviews.Title: Appears to be okay.
Reviews.Author: Chad Griffey
Reviews.Content: I am hoping this product is effective but honestly hope I never had to find out.  I did make the mistake of washing it in the washing machine before using it and found this to be a horrible mistake.  The bag contains fiberglass and began to unravel at the seams.  I used duct tape to secure the seams together and have noticed that any time you retrieve or add something to the bag my arm begins to itch until I wash it off with cold water.

Reviews.Title: Check back later
Reviews.Author: gFiskjr
Reviews.Content: Check back later once my house is in a fire and my documents are either safe or burnt to a crisp

Reviews.Title: EXTRA PROTECTION FOR IMPORTANT PAPERS
Reviews.Author: Passat_GLX
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THESE FOR PEACE OF MIND AS I HAVE A FIRE AND WATER PROOF SAFE THAT ADVISED TO PLACE ANY PAPERS IN THE SAFE SUCH AS BILL OF SALE FOR CAR AND BIRTH CERTIFICATES INTO FIRE RESISTANT DOCUMENT BAGS TO PREVENT SCORCHING IN CASE OF FIRE. THESE FIT THE BILL !

Reviews.Title: Do not touch these without gloves!
Reviews.Author: lvrorx
Reviews.Content: Lesson learned! Read the reviews! It is like shoving your hands into fiberglass insulation!I hope to heck this actually is fire resistant, but from what I am reading, maybe not so much. Not sure what to do with it now...

Reviews.Title: Bought for my husband
Reviews.Author: Sandra S.
Reviews.Content: I got this for my husband and I personally thought that the bag was to big but he loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: DrAlloway
Reviews.Content: You have your important documents stashed away in a safe place.BUT, if there is a fire, what will happen ??This pouch is As Advertised and the best price I could find anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Doc Bag
Reviews.Author: Kimberley A. Mauldin "Kim Mauldin"
Reviews.Content: This bag has small threads of some type of material that breaks off and is very sharp to the touch.  Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: tears easily
Reviews.Author: D.C. Julie
Reviews.Content: I never saw this product put to the test through a fire.  I am buying a new product because it caught on a sharp edge in my filing cabinet and ripped terribly.  The weave, once opened, unravels very rapidly.  No matter how carefully I move it, every time I open it, it is ripping more and more.  If you can figure out how to store it safe from any sharp edges, maybe it will work for fire!  Just be careful with it.

Reviews.Title: lots of fiber glass shedding
Reviews.Author: Rez
Reviews.Content: as noted in several other locations, this product sheds fiber glass like crazy.  The edges of the material are ragged and frayed.  While the product has a faily tight weave it is still not air tight so any extrem heat will likely turn the contents to ash.  I plan on doing exactly that experiment with the product because I don't want the debris from the bag all over the inside of my fire resistant document box.

Reviews.Title: Awful, do not waste your money
Reviews.Author: Here or There
Reviews.Content: This thing is full of fiberglass. I didn't read the reviews either.  What a waste of money and caused severe itching for days.  Water and soap wouldn't wash it off.

Reviews.Title: Protection for Valuable Papers
Reviews.Author: Diggerrose
Reviews.Content: We won't know how good this is until there is  a fire.  However, one has to begin somewhere.  Since it wasn't expensive I bought it for our valuable papers and placed it in our safe.

Reviews.Title: a complete mistake on my part
Reviews.Author: jstnfly
Reviews.Content: this product is made of fiberglass, i found out the hard way that fiberglass gets inside of your skin and irritates it REALLY BAD and it hurts...this should never be used at all, i was going to keep cash in it...OOOPS!

Reviews.Title: Handy
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A. Harrell "WarDog"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THESE. I think this was one of my better purchases for security. I already have a fire resistant safe, but these make it even more so. I CAN NOT RECOMMEND THESE ENOUGH

Reviews.Title: this is what I did
Reviews.Author: Just Me
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on this product, I decided to just place my doc's on a piece of fiberglass insulation (I had extra in my garage) and rolled everything up. (while wearing gloves of course).

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, I'll get getting more
Reviews.Author: Janizary
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these fire ressistant bags to store documents in a fire-resistant safe. I was somewhat wary given some of the negative reviews that some others have left regarding fibers, and poor craftsmanship. Perhaps I got a different batch, however, the two bags I ordered were very well tailored, with no flaking fibres, very thick and strongly stitched. I am VERY pleased by the two bags I ordered and will be ordering a few more in the near future.

Reviews.Title: bigbass
Reviews.Author: bigbass
Reviews.Content: Very good idea and is working as intended.  Another layer of safety against fire can't hurt and is helpful when valuables are kept in a safe or other fireproof device.

Reviews.Title: does its job
Reviews.Author: christine70360
Reviews.Content: It the right size and closes easy. Fits good in the safe. The only thing I didn't look at when I ordered it was that it was fiber glass. When I took it out to look at it the fiber glass got all over me and I was itching so bad. I haven't used it yet because I really don't want to touch it and itch. I will use it one day but for now it's still in the shipping box.

Reviews.Title: Good quality
Reviews.Author: Bigdog
Reviews.Content: The only reason I didnt go 5 stars is because I havent tried the fireproof part of it.Its a very thick sturdy bag.
